page.title: 02Farming Crosthwaite'area'
page.content: Our 3x4 Km. block contains{eighteen {working}farms,predominantly{sheep farms, with some milk production from {Friesians}for the Milk Marketing Board.The sheep are mainly Rough Fell. Other breeds include Blue Leicesters, Swaledale, Masham and Teeswater. .The Masham being good for fat lamb production.Most of the acreage is split between{rough grazing}and better {pasture,}the latter cut for hay or silage in the summer. A small percentage of the total acreage comprises{deciduous}woodland.Each farm has a small{orchard}with{damson}and {apple}trees.At two farms{new breeds of {cattle}have been introduced-{'Salers' the first of their kind in this country and{Blonde d'Acquitaines'.}The farms are{family}run with one or two generations working together,employing occasional{contract labour.
